FuncDef:
The cpu-defend policy command creates an attack defense policy.
The undo cpu-defend policy command deletes the configuration.
By default, no attack defense policy is configure on the device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an attack defense policy.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 30.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A user can create an attack defense policy as required, modify the configurations of the required features, and then apply the policy to the interface boards. For the features that are not configured in the attack defense policy by the user, the configurations in the default attack defense policy are adopted. After an attack defense policy is configured, you can run the display cpu-defend policy command to view the configurations in the attack defense policy.
Follow-up Procedure
The configured attack defense policy can take effect only after it is applied to interface boards through the cpu-defend-policy command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
